In this case, the original statement is 'If P (Sue chose pizza), then Q (Bob chose pasta)', and the contrapositive argument is 'If Q (Bob chose pasta), then P (Sue chose pizza)'.

Since the contrapositive argument is logically equivalent to the original statement, and the original statement is a valid argument, then the contrapositive argument is also a valid argument.
